meanings.definition: A nobleman or warrior in Anglo-Saxon England.
meanings.sent1: The thegn bravely defended his village from invaders.
meanings.sent2: The thegn was respected for his courage and leadership.
meanings.sent3: The thegn's armor was so shiny, it blinded his foes in battle!
meanings.sent4: In the chess game of life, he was the thegn, moving with strategic grace.
meanings.sent5: The thegn's sword gleamed like a beacon of strength in the dark.

meanings.definition: To appoint or hold the position of a thegn.
meanings.sent1: The king decided to thegn him as the guardian of the northern lands.
meanings.sent2: She hopes to thegn the position of leadership with honor and wisdom.
meanings.sent3: He will thegn the role of protector with unwavering dedication.
meanings.sent4: In her heart, she thegns the responsibility with pride and determination.
meanings.sent5: To thegn such a crucial role requires both skill and loyalty.
